net.xuset.objectIO.netObj

Class AbstractNetObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.netObj.AbstractNetObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NetClass, NetFunc, NetVar

    public abstract class AbstractNetObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements NetObject
    Helper class so implementations will not have to define a trivial getId() method every time. The only method implemented in this class is getId().
    Since:
    1.0

        Parameters:
        id - the id that will be returned by getId()

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Description copied from interface: NetObject
        Gets the unique id associated with this NetObject. The id is used to determine which NetObject an update message or serialized message belongs to.

        No two NetObjects should have the same id and be in the same scope. Meaning it is okay to have two NetObjects with the same id as long as they are not stored together. For example, if you have two NetClass objects with id's "netClass1" and "netClass2" it is okay to have two different NetObjects with the same id as long as they are not stored within the same NetClass object.

        Specified by:
        getId in interface NetObject
        Returns:
        the id of this object
